fields.title: Server Address
fields.name: url
fields.description: URL of the SendGrid server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.title: API Key
fields.name: api_key
fields.description: API key configured for your account to access the SendGrid server.

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set as True.

operations.title: Send Email
operations.description: Sends an email using SendGrid based on the From and To recipients and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: From
parameters.tooltip: The 'From' email address used to deliver the message
parameters.name: from_email
parameters.description: The email ID of the sender from whose account you want to send the email. This address must be a verified sender in your SendGrid account.

parameters.title: To Recipients
parameters.tooltip: The email address of the recipients, in csv or list format
parameters.name: to_emails
parameters.description: The email IDs of the recipients, in CSV or list format, towhose account you want to deliver the email.

parameters.title: CC Recipients
parameters.tooltip: CSV / List Format
parameters.description: (Optional) The email IDs of the members, in CSV or list format, that you want to add to the CC list of the email.
parameters.name: cc_recipients

parameters.title: BCC Recipients
parameters.tooltip: CSV / List Format
parameters.description: (Optional) The email IDs of the members, in CSV or list format, that you want to add to the BCC list of the email.
parameters.name: bcc_recipients

parameters.title: Subject
parameters.tooltip: The subject of your email
parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: (Optional) The subject of your email that you want to send using your SendGrid account.

parameters.title: Plain Text Body Content
parameters.tooltip: The plain text body of the email
parameters.name: plain_text_content
parameters.description: (Optional) The body of the email in plain text, which you want to send using your SendGrid account.

parameters.title: HTML Body Content
parameters.tooltip: The html body of the email
parameters.name: html_content
parameters.description: (Optional) The body of the email in HTML, which you want to send using your SendGrid account.

parameters.title: Attachment IRIs
parameters.tooltip: CSV / List Format
parameters.description: (Optional) The list of IRI ID(s) of the file(s), in CSV or list format, that you want to attach to the email using your SendGrid account. IRI IDs are used to access files from the 'Attachments' module in FortiSOAR.
parameters.name: iri_list

parameters.title: Inline Attachment IRIs
parameters.tooltip: CSV / List Format
parameters.description: (Optional) The list of IRI ID(s) of the file(s), in CSV or list format, that you want to add inline to the email using your SendGrid account. IRI IDs are used to access files from the 'Attachments' module in FortiSOAR.
parameters.name: inline_iri_list

parameters.title: Batch ID
parameters.tooltip: An ID representing a batch of emails to be sent at the same time. Including a batch_id in your request allows you include this email in that batch. It also enables you to cancel or pause the delivery of that batch. For more information
parameters.name: batch_id
parameters.description: An ID representing a batch of emails to be sent at the same time using your SendGrid account. Including abatch_idin your request allows you to include this email in that batch and also enables you to cancel or pause the delivery of that batch.

parameters.title: Scheduled Timestamp
parameters.tooltip: A unix timestamp allowing you to specify when you want your email to be delivered.
parameters.name: send_at
parameters.description: A UNIX timestamp allowing you to specify when you want this email to be delivered.

operations.title: Get Email Statistics
operations.description: Retrieves your email statistics between a specified date range from SendGrid based on the type of email statistics and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Email Statistics By
parameters.tooltip: Get email statistics by selected input
parameters.name: stats_by
parameters.description: Retrieves email statistics based on the selected input type from SendGrid. You can choose between Global Email Statistics,Country And State Province, Device Type, Client Type, Mailbox Provider, and Browser. If you choose 'Global Email Statistics','Device Type',or'Client Type', then no other input parameter is required. If you choose 'Country And State Province', then you must specify the following parameter: Country: The country for which you want to retrieve the email statistics from SendGrid. Currently, support is forUS and CA only. If you choose 'Mailbox Provider', then you must specify the following parameter: Mailbox Providers: The mailbox providers for which you want to retrieve the email statistics from SendGrid. You can include up to 10 mailbox providers. If you choose 'Browser', then you must specify the following parameter: Browsers: The browsers for which you want to retrieve the email statistics from SendGrid. You can include up to 10 different browsers.

Country And State Province.title: Country
Country And State Province.tooltip: The country you would like to see statistics for. Currently only supported for US and CA.
Country And State Province.name: country
Country And State Province.description: The country you would like to see statistics for. Currently only supported for US and CA.

Mailbox Provider.title: Mailbox Providers
Mailbox Provider.tooltip: The mail box providers to get statistics for. You can include up to 10
Mailbox Provider.name: mailbox_providers
Mailbox Provider.description: The mail box providers to get statistics for. You can include up to 10

Browser.title: Browsers
Browser.tooltip: The browsers to get statistics for. You can include up to 10 different browsers
Browser.name: browsers
Browser.description: The browsers to get statistics for. You can include up to 10 different browsers

parameters.title: Start Date
parameters.tooltip: The starting date of the statistics to retrieve.Time is not considered
parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The starting date from when you want to retrieve the email statistics from SendGrid. It must followYYYY-MM-DDformat. Note: Time is not considered

parameters.title: End Date
parameters.tooltip: The end date of the statistics to retrieve. Defaults to today.Time is not considered
parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end date till when you want to retrieve the email statistics from SendGrid. By default, it is set to 'today', and it must followYYYY-MM-DDformat. Note: Time is not considered

parameters.title: Aggregate Result By
parameters.tooltip: How to group the statistics. Available values "day", "week", or "month".
parameters.name: aggregated_by
parameters.description: The basis on which to group the email statistics retrieved from SendGrid. You can choose from day, week, or month.

operations.title: Search Emails
operations.description: Filter all email messages to search your email activity in SendGrid based on the input query you have specified.

parameters.title: Query
parameters.tooltip: Use the query syntax to filter your email activity.
parameters.placeholder: e.g. subject="This is a subject test"
parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query syntax that you want to use to filter your email activity in SendGrid. For example,subject="This is a subject test", from_email="testing@sendgrid.net", etc. For more information on parameters that you can use in a query and filtering email messages, seehttps://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/e-mail-activity/filter-all-messages.

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.tooltip: The number of results to return.
parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: (Optional) The maximum number of items that this operation should return in a single search.

operations.title: Get Contact List
operations.description: Returns an array of all of your contact lists fromSendGrid

operations.title: Get Alerts
operations.description: Retrieves all of your alerts fromSendGrid.

operations.title: Create Batch ID
operations.description: Generates a new batch ID in SendGrid. Once abatch_idis created, you can associate it with a scheduled send using the "Send Email" action to schedule sending a batch of emails at the same time using your SendGrid account. Passing thebatch_idas a field in the request body of the "Send Email" action assigns the batch ID to the schedule send you are creating.

operations.title: Get Scheduled Send
operations.description: Retrieves all canceled and paused scheduled send information from SendGrid based on the batch_id you have specified.

parameters.title: Batch ID
parameters.tooltip: Retrieve the cancel/paused scheduled send information for a specific batch_id
parameters.name: batch_id
parameters.description: The batch id whose canceled or paused scheduled send information you want to retrieve from SendGrid.

operations.title: Update Scheduled Send
operations.description: Cancels or pauses a scheduled send that is associated with the batch_id you have specified.

parameters.title: Batch ID
parameters.tooltip: The batch ID is the identifier that your scheduled mail sends share.
parameters.name: batch_id
parameters.description: The batch ID whose scheduled send (mail) you want to cancel or pause.

parameters.title: Status
parameters.tooltip: The status of the send you would like to implement. This can be pause or cancel
parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The action (status) that you want to perform on the scheduled send. You can choose betweenPauseorCancel.

operations.title: Delete Scheduled Send
operations.description: Deletes a scheduled send that is associated with the batch_id you have specified. Note: Scheduled sends that are canceled less than 10 minutes before the scheduled time are not guaranteed to be canceled.

parameters.title: Batch ID
parameters.tooltip: The batch ID is the identifier that your scheduled mail sends share.
parameters.name: batch_id
parameters.description: The batch ID whose scheduled send (mail) you want to delete.
